clients

Class SQLClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • clients.SQLClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client

    public class SQLClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements Client
    the client used to execute a CommandRequest which belongs to oracle's SQL and also can be single instated to handle oracle's SQL
    Author:
    zhangyutao

      • getColumnType

        public int getColumnType(javax.sql.RowSet rs,
                         java.lang.String ColName)
        Get Column Type of a specified column name from the row set you provide and return a int which is referred to java.sql.Types.
        Parameters:
        rs - - the Rowset from you previous executed SQL statments.
        ColName - - the column name which type you want to get.
        Returns:
        if nothing found, it will return null.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getAllValueByColName

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllValueByColName(javax.sql.RowSet rs,
                                                                  java.lang.String ColName)
        Get all values of a specified column name from the Row set you provide and return the all the value as String in an ArrayList type.
        Parameters:
        rs - - the Rowset from you previous executed SQL statments.
        ColName - - the column name in which the string values you want to get.
        Returns:
        if nothing found, it will return a empty ArrayList().
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getAllColumnNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllColumnNames(javax.sql.RowSet rs)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        if nothing found, it will return a empty ArrayList().

      • getAllValueByColNameAndType

        private <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> getAllValueByColNameAndType(javax.sql.RowSet rs,
                                                               java.lang.String columnname,
                                                               int sqlType)
        Execute the SQL statement and return a Arraylist in your self defined content type.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        strStmt -
        columnname - - which column you want to check. if give null, it would not check the column name but requires there is only one column in RowSet.
        sqlType - - use the indicate what type of value should be in DB. About the exact value, please refer to java.sql.Types.
        Returns:
        -please use T to designate what type of Arraylist you need. like "ArrayList".

      • singeSQLGetStringValue

        public java.lang.String singeSQLGetStringValue(javax.sql.RowSet rs)
        Execute the single SQL statement and return a single String value result.
        Parameters:
        rs -
        Returns:
        value or null if query returns no rows SQL that returns a single row and a single integer value. If the SQL returns multiple rows, multiple columns, an update count, etc. an exception will be thrown.

      • singeSQLGetINTValue

        public int singeSQLGetINTValue(javax.sql.RowSet rs)
        Execute the single SQL statement and return a single int value result.
        Parameters:
        rs -
        Returns:
        value or null if query returns no rows SQL that returns a single row and a single integer value. If the SQL returns multiple rows, multiple columns, an update count, etc. an exception will be thrown.

      • transformToHashMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer[],java.lang.Object> transformToHashMap(javax.sql.RowSet rs)
                                                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Transform RowSet to HashMap type.
        Parameters:
        rs -
        Returns:
        - a map contains all data of a rowset. The key of the map is a Integer[] type value which indicates the original position where the data is stored in the Rowset. The Integer{0,n} of the map stores column names."HashMap" means "mydata" is linked to key the Integer{1,2} which means "mydata" was in 1st row and 2end col of the rowset.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
